title: Hy-Wired
body: <a href="http://www.wired.com/news/autotech/0,2554,63467,00.html">Wired</a> has a brief article on GM's new Hy-Wire fuel-cell platform for its future vehicles.  It sounds really futurustic.  Has tons of sweet features and looks similar to the new Prius: <br/><a href="http://www.gm.com/company/gm_exp_live/events/paris_2002/gm/hywire/index.html"><img src="http://a1112.g.akamai.net/7/1112/492/2002091454/www.wired.com/news/images/full/x02cc_co150_f.jpg"/></a><br/> Too bad we won't see them till around 2015 or so.  Which should give GM enough time to fix the glitches mentioned in the article.  "'It's for the PlayStation generation, when they grow up,' the rep told [the author]. [She] asked if they made an Atari version. Quite seriously, [she] was told that, yes, they could make one." Hopefully by then they'll also make an AWD version for rugged folks like me. (<a href="http://www.gm.com/company/gm_exp_live/events/paris_2002/gm/hywire/video.html">videos</a>)
